captions.text: Gorky Film Studio
SEVENTEEN MOMENTS OF SPRING
Part 7
Dear Nazi party comrade Mr. Bormann, sir.

I am grateful for the confidence
and trust, which you showed to you.
Get quickly inside my car!

I saw you somewhere before. 
Remove your stupid camouflage.

-Yes, most definitely, I saw you before. 
-Correct. You awarded me the Iron Cross.

You said then that I have face of a 
professor of mathematics, and not a spy’s.

But now you have a face of a spy, 
not of a professor's.

Now tell me in details about everything
bad what had happened?

Today, on March 10, 1945 the forces of 
the 2nd Belorussian Front of Red Army

conducted successful combats in order
to defeat the Pomerania group of enemy.

The forces of 3rd Ukrainian Front north 
of Balaton lake in Hungary fought

against the attacks of the large forces 
of German infantry and tanks. .

Paying a huge price of large losses the 
German troops at some sections of the

Front were able to wedge in 
into the Russian defense lines.

The 4th Ukrainian Front with the 
the Czechoslovakian units

began the Moravian-Ostravskuh 
offensive operation against Germans.

With the purpose of capturing of the 
Moravian-Ostravskim industrial region.

With subsequent attacks in Olomouts 
and then fighting in Prague direction.

Top Secret. 
Personal file of Barbara Krein.

Untersharfuhrer SS 4th department 
of RSHA - Intelligence.
Member of the Nazi Party since 1944

True Aryan race. Personality of 
a Nordic type. Iron strong will.
Fully devoted to her work duties.
Friendly and honest with co-workers
Ambitious sportswoman
Merciless to the enemies of the Reich
Not married.
Incriminating relations never had
Dear ladies, please come to the table.

I never thought that I would ever 
celebrate my birthday like this.

With a Russian spy woman and a 
head wounded soldier like him.

I understand you well. Yesterday should 
have been a birthday of my dear husband.

I was planning to celebrate it 
entirely different too.

-Shell I carry the child to bed? 
-Thanks, but I'd like to do it myself.

-According to the instruction, 
this must be done by Helmut only.
Please. Have a drink.

-Happy birthday to you. 
-Thank you.
And now it is time to sleep, dear.

To give birth and to feed babies 
that is a true purpose of a woman.

Everything else is not natural for
a woman, a chimera, invented by

the corrupt bourgeois democracies 
and Stalin's regime of Russia.
People must be healthy and strong.

There is nothing cleaner than healthy 
physiological human instincts.

I am not ashamed to speak 
about this freely and openly.
What do you mean by that?

Doing it today with one, then with 
another, tomorrow with someone else?
Family is holy and firm.

But in the bed with my husband, 
the father of my children,

I cannot get as delighted 
by the force of love,
as if I would be with a new lover?

No more shame or shyness in bed.
That is also a chimera.

If me and my husband are able to love 
each other in the manner that we want,
then the infidelity will never happen.

A woman departs to a lover 
searching a new sexual power.

-You, probably, don't agree with me? 
-No, I do not agree with you.

-Why? -Just because... 
-That is not an answer.

A desire to produce a better impression is 
a woman's trick, as ancient as this world.

Do really you think that our good but 
stupid Helmut will prefer you to me?

He fears and hates Slavs, 
and also I am younger than you.

-I hate all women. 
-Why?
What do you hate us for?

Women are worse than villains. 
With villains, at least, all is clear.

A woman is nice at first, then 
she makes you lose your head.

And then you would even find her 
sleeping with your best friend.

Was it your own wife? 
Did she cheat on you?

-Excuse me, may I go to my room now? 
-Why do you want to go?

Today there is no bombing, and
you yet did not begin your work.
So, let's stay a bit longer than usual.

-I simply worry about my baby.
He might be awoken and hungry by now.
And why would he be awake?

Helmut, how long did the child 
sleep today already?

One hour before and after the nursing. 
Kids like to sleep in this age.

He slept outside on the balcony, but
I am afraid, it's too cold for him.
Will you allow me to sleep with my baby?

I am afraid, Helmut is not getting 
enough sleep because of the baby.

That's not right. I sleep very well. 
The baby boy is calm and doesn't cry.

It is forbidden. You and the child 
must sleep in separate rooms.

I will not run away from here. 
Here you have strong locks.
It is impossible to run away from here.

There are two of us here and the 
locks, actually, are really strong.

I am sorry, but I have my 
orders from my management.
You may try talking to your new boss.

-And who is my new boss? 
-Shtandartenfurer SS Mr. Shtirlitz.

He is a kind person, and he might 
change the order from the management.

If you will succeed in your work 
for us, of course.

Some do it for money, 
the others do it for sex.

Your stimulus for a good work for us is the 
most compelling - your child, isn't it so?
Yes, you are right.
May I?

It seems that you wanted to 
say something to me, didn't you?
Well, say it then.

What would you do if you would 
be in my situation?

Would you collaborate with an enemy in 
order to save the life of your child?
I don't know what to tell you?

-By the way, did you give your child a name? 
-I will name him Vladimir.

Is this in whose honor? 
Your father was called Vladimir?

-Or the baby's father? What was his name? 
-Whose name?

-Your husband's. 
-Ervin.

I know his name's Ervin here in Germany,
but what is his original Russian name.
I only knew him as Ervin.

Oh really? So he never told 
you his real name?

-Was he an Ervin, when you got married? 
-We never had a wedding.

-That is untruth. 
-This is truth. Well, it was in Germany.
I was infiltrated together with Ervin.

In my opinion your, German, spies, just 
like any other spies of entire world,
know each other only by code names.

My real name is Katya, not Ket, 
And my chiefs in Moscow know that.

And, probably, that was known to some people, 
who were connected to my husband in Germany.
All right then, you may go and rest now.
Tomorrow we'll have a trip to Ransdorf.

That was your idea to drive to the places, 
where you drove with your husband.
Yes, that was my idea.

I’ll be seen that I have my freedoms, and
that would calm down possible coconspirators.

And also, I’m not sure that the main spy 
resident wouldn’t have a second radio transmitter.

He easily could have transmitted already 
to my Moscow bosses about my betrayal.

He could do that, if he does not obtain a 
proof about the fact that I am still free.
Then your entire radio game will go badly.

Your main spy person, "The Resident", 
does not have a second transmitter.

And you must thank god, that your 
current boss is Mr. Shtirlitz.

He is famous for his extra liberalism 
and a strong logic.

Tomorrow he'll drive you around the city. 
Did he tell you about that?

I did not know about it. No one
ever told me who my boss is.

I have only suggested once about 
the usefulness of such an action,

and I was never told who will 
actually carry it out with me.

Here are the fingerprints found  
on the telephone receiver

in the room of special direct
government phone connection.

And these fingerprints were found 
on the suitcase with the spy radio

transmitter of the Russian 
woman, the radio operator.
They are identical.
What does that mean?

This means that it is necessary 
to, secretly, collect fingerprints
of all workers of our and other departments.

- Everybody's fingerprints? 
-Yes. Everybody's fingerprints.

It is necessary for me to have 
your official permission for that
Consider that you just obtained it.
You don't need my fingerprints, do you?
Only for the history, reichsfurer, sir.
What's with the chauffeur of Bormann?
He resisted our tortures for 3 hours.

Then we increased the tortures and he confessed, 
that at night someone got into Bormann’s car.

He did not hear their conversation, 
they were separated by a glass in the car.

He was presented with more than
200 pictures of our officers.

Not in any of them he recognized 
the night collocutor of Bormann.
And what do you intend to do with him further?
Probably, he will die in a car crash?

The driver, judging by your words, 
is a good, honest person.

and we do not punish honest people,
who didn't do anything wrong.

-Invent some other death cause for him. 
-All right, I will come up with something for him.

It's hard to invent death causes, when it
is for the driver of the deputy of the Fuhrer.

I thought, you could be a way more 
inventive in that area than me.

But if you think that I should invent it
myself, I will come up with something new.
Just come up with it faster.

I am not intending to keep alive 
no double dealers like that driver.

Shtirlitz left for the Swiss border, in order to 
prepare a secret crossing point. "A window".

He, just like Shellenberg, considered that 
the legal transfer of pastor through the border
could create the undesirable publicity.

This entire operation was 
accomplished behind the Gestapo.

Exposing pastor Shlag, as a conspirator,
after he would do his part in the play,

must be realized, according to Shelenberg's 
plan, personally, by Shtirlitz.

A few days before the departure, 
with an approval from Schulenburg,

Shtirlitz was preparing a list of candidates 
in co-conspirators for the pastor.

All of those people were zealous and 
devoted servants of German Nazism.

They are, so-called "conspirators", who 
actually, sent our dear pastor to Bern.

They are from the department 
of Mr. Ribbentrop.

Krauze, von Gitts, Blyutner. 
The people of Goering, from Luftwaffe.

I selected these diplomats and pilots so 
that they respectively would compromise
Ribbentrop and Goering.
Moreover, Shvalpeff is Bormann’s man.
That is also good in our game.

A Bormann’s agent in the Foreign Ministry. 
What a dirty conspirator!

All these people, among other things, 
in the different times were recruited
by the Gestapo. As informants.
This is very good, Shtirlitz.
This is promising.

Muller must be held on the bridle, and 
this must be a sufficiently strong bridle.

Thus, we compromise here in Berlin 
and in the West those people,
who search for peace besides us.

And in the West they clearly demarcate 
between the Gestapo, the Bormann’s office
and our department. The Intelligence.

It will beneficial, when we expose 
this plot, for us to say that

all these criminals are connected 
with the Gestapo.
Coffee?

By this train, which plied inside the corridor 
from Scandinavia to Switzerland, nowadays

mostly only diplomats were able to travel. 
Shtirlitz occupied seat# 16.

A seat# 46 in the next train car 
was occupied by a professor from Sweden

with a simple Scandinavian 
last name, Mr. Svedeborg.

- Are you a German? 
- Unfortunatelly. I am.

- Why did you say "unfortunately"? 
- Because they don't bring me coffee twice.

Coffee is given here twice only 
to those, with foreign passports.

I am German too, but they gave
me coffee the second time.

I have a cognac. 
Would you like a drink with me?
Thanks. I do have a cognac too.
Then you do not have good salami.
I do have some salami too.
This means that we both are well supplied.

- What is your military rank? 
- I am not in the army. I am a diplomat.

- I am an adviser in the Foreign Ministry. 
- So, you are the one whom everyone hates.

- You're guilty for all we are having right now! 
- But why?
Because you determine our foreign policy.

You brought us to the war for the two Fronts
in the East and in the West at the same time.
Prozt! To ur hlth!
Prozit! To your health.
You must be from Meklenburg region?

- Yes. That's right. How you did know? 
- By your words "prozt" and "To ur hlth".

- All northerners economize on the vowels. 
- This is very funny, but true.

Could not I see you yesterday at the 
Ministry of Aviation by some chance?
No, I wasn't there yesterday.

Shtirlitz lied. 
He indeed was there yesterday.

He was at the Ministry of Aviation
along with pastor Shlag.
A strange property of my physiogomy:

- Everybody thinks they just saw me somewhere. 
- Because you have a stereotypical face.

- You are similar to many others. 
- Is this a good or a bad thing?

For a spy it is a great feature, 
but for a diplomat it is a bad one.
In your job you need a very recognized face.
What faces need army men?

For our army men most important 
now is to have strong legs to run.

- What about some brain in the head? 
- A head has nothing to do with that!

Our leaders think for us. We only fulfill 
their orders. Now the most important is

to have strong legs, in order to run 
away out of the army in time.

Aren't you afraid to openly talk like that 
with a total stranger like myself?

- You do not know my name. 
- This is easy to establish, since

- you have a very memorizible face. 
- Oh, yeagh?

It always seemed to me that my
face is the most typical one.
Anyway! Who cares!

By the time you'd write the denunciation, 
and the secret police would investigate it,

too much time will pass and the war 
will be finished by then anyway.

We'll be charged in military courts not by our 
current leaders, but by the winning allies.

And in the first place you, the diplomats, 
will be prosecuted by military tribunals.

You, the army, did the killings, burnt people 
in the ovens, but to prosecute us, the diplomats?

We carried out orders. SS tortured and burnt people. 
And we, the army men, were fighting an enemy.

I didn't know that was invented a new method of war 
without burning people and without the war victims?

A war in one way or another is a good thing, 
but certainly not a foolish war like ours now.
This is a war of a military amateur.

He, the Fuhrer, decided to conduct a war, without 
military academy training. Simply playing by ear.

He decided, that only he alone knows 
what each of us needs in this life.

He's convinced, that he's the only one 
who truly loves our great Germany,
and that we all are only thinking about how to

how to sell out our Germany 
to the Hebrew Bolshevik Cossacks.

Hebrew Cossacks! This is something new! 
I never knew that such a thing is even possible.

Anything is possible by those Russians. 
But from the Americans I expect the same.

I fight Americans for a year. Those guys will 
be ruined by their own technology someday.

They think that the war can be won 
by air bombings alone. Prozt!

They will be increasing their technical military 
power and they will gulp in its flow someday.

It will decompose them as rust.  They believe 
that they are permitted to do whatever they want.

The Russians also think so, because
they are wild and poor people.

The Americans think that way 
because they are too rich.
Therefore wars are necessary.

- There is no logic in your words. 
- What are you saying?

I am saying that there is no logic 
in your arguments. Something is missing.

Nothing is missing in my arguments. 
Countries are like living things.

They can't remain static for a long time. 
They get suffocated by country borders.

They require some motion. This is an axiom. 
Such a motion is a war.

But you, goddamned diplomats, did everything
wrong, so you all must be destroyed.

We, too, carried out our orders. 
We are the same soldiers like you are.

- We are the soldiers of the Fuhrer. 
- Stop this bullshit!

Goddamned soldiers of the Fuhrer! He is of the 
lowest army rank, but he tries to manage it.
I am terrified talking to you, General.

Don't lie to me and yourself! 
Everyone in Germany speaks like me now.
Or at least everyone thinks that way.

And what about the young boys 
from the Hitlerjugend units?

When they go against the Russian tanks, 
do they think that way too?
They die with the words "Hail Hitler!"

A crazy fanaticism never provides 
a final victory in wars.
One get tired of the fanaticism very soon.

And then, this fanaticism is dissolved 
in the heads of those maniacs only.

Fanatics can prevail at first. 
But they can never have a victory.

Because they will get tired of themselves. 
Prozt!

- And why won't you surrender your division to 
the enemy then?  - It is more than 1 division.

Even better then. Why won't you surrender 
all your divisions to the enemy?

And what will happen to my family then? 
What about those fanatics in the central office?

And about those crazies, who would fight
to death, believing in a mythical victory,

- than surrendering to the allies. 
- But you can issue an order to surrender.
The orders are issued to die.

There could be no orders to surrendering to 
the enemy. They would never give such orders.

- And if you do obtain such an order? 
- From whom? From that neurasthenic Hitler?
He pulls all of us with him into the grave.
To die in the solitude is a terrible thing.

To die with masses is like a nothing.
One can even joke about it easily.

And what if you do obtain such an 
order from Field Marshal Keitel?

He thinks with his fat ass instead of his head. 
He is a secretary, but not a military commander.

- What about your commander-in-chief in Italy? 
- Kesselring?

- He will never do it. 
- Why?
He is from the staff school of Goering,

and anyone, who works directly 
under a big Nazi leader,
compulsorily lose personal initiative.

Awkwardness is acquired, 
he becomes a good analyst,

but loses the ability to make 
independent decisions.

Before he'd decide to make a step, compulsorily 
he will consult his boss about it first.

- Whose boss? 
- His boss. Goering himself.

Are you certain that he cannot be persuaded 
for such a step without Hering's approval?

-If I wouldn't be convinced, I wouldn't say it. 
-Do you believe that this is even possible?
I believe that this is possible.

Also I believe in a soon end for 
all of us. For all of us!

It is not so scary, believe me, 
when everyone would be gone at once.
Our defeat will be so crushing.

That recollections about it will wound the 
hearts of many generations of poor Germans.
I told my children: I hate any democracy!
No democracy in our Reich!

Any democracy in our country is doomed 
to end up with one thing:
the dictatorship of small shopkeepers.

The more freedom we have, the sooner we 
want to be controlled by SS troops again.

And then we want our the secret police 
back, and concentration death camps again,

and the universal fear everywhere!
Only then we feel ourselves calm and secure.

No need to prove your point of view in 
defending the fate of the home land.
No responsibility.

Just raise your hand in the honor of him, 
who will take care of everything for you,

Just shout out "Hail Hitler!" and 
everything will become understandable.
No more worries.

The border guards will check fast. 
I only have a few passengers today.
Would you like buy cigarettes, sir?
- Hail Hitler!

- Hail Hitler! I wish you to 
destroy all your enemies.
- Thanks. We will break their heads.
- I have no doubt about that.

A Swedish scientist with a Scandinavian 
last name Svedeborg in his passport,

was going to Bern, Switzeland.
That was professor Pleyshner.

He was going to Bern, Switzerland 
to bring a spy message from Shtirlitz.

The message was about Shellenberg's game, 
and about the contact with Bormann,
and also about Ket's arrest.

Shtirlitz wrote in it about his spy work 
and how to get in contact with him now.

Now he was going to the border patrol 
guard office to get a car

in order to drive to a special distant 
mountain border check point.

Pastor Shlag will have to illegally 
cross the border with Switzerland there.
Border guard office of Gottmatingen.

I clearly see now, why you would
be so agreeable in helping me.

In this snowy blue paradise it is 
not possible to even visualize
either hunger or bombings or ruins of war.

What if I would need to transfer illegally 
through the border not a single person,

but, let's say, a few people and without 
any permission from my management,

I see that this could be done without a problem. 
We'll talk just a little and then do it. Right?

Well, sure. At this moment, we all need to start 
talking before it is too late for all of us.
How shell I understand this?
You yourself provoked me to the frankness.

- Do you still believe in the frankness? 
- Certainly, I do.

Even between me, a Colonel of SS, 
and you, an army Lieutenant?

- Will please forgive, sir Colonel! Sir! 
- It's OK. Please continue.

With me it is OK to be a little frank 
and honest, but I don't do this with others.
And especially about why I am here for.

For my complete peace of mind 
will you please repeat you task.

Not long before your departure I 
will receive a telegram from Berlin.

"Our dear mom feels worse. If possible, 
please send medicines". Signed as Hans.
This means that

one car with keys and no driver must await 
on the street next to the train station.

Another car will be at the 8th kilometer 
by a water stream near the border.

At map area 5, by the border itself, 
I will leave a pair of skis.

Not new ones, Swiss productions skis 
and the hand knitted wool gloves.

- And finally, the ski boots, size 42. 
- Size 43 !

Please forgive me my mistake. 
Yes, of course, boots size 43.

They must be Swiss made and 
have a sign "Made in Bern".

Everything is accurate. I hope, you would 
not forget, that answering any questions,
concerning this operation,

you may only to reichsfurer 
SS Himmler personally?
Only to him only and to no one else.

Please call for my car. It's time 
to go back to the train station.
Bern, Switzerland.

The text of this telegram 
Pleyshner memorized by heart.

Hanz Frok. The conditions of 
the contract are acceptable.
The signing of the contract will happen in 3 days

at the hotel Atlantic under 
the previously announced address.

Pleyshner carried out the first 
task given him by Shtirlitz.
Here you go. 2 Franks please.

In a day that message will 
be in Moscow, Russia.

Himmler through his General SS 
Wolf started secret negotiations

with official representatives of the 
Western allies in Bern, Switzerland.
Yustas.

Pleyshner walked to a secret spy apartment. 
The address of it told him Shtirlitz.

There was yet half-hour before the 
time of a possible meeting.

In this cigarette was an ampule 
with a deadly poison.

Pleyshner obtained it for himself just in case. 
When and “if” there will be no other choice.

Now, being here, it all seemed 
like a silly child game.

Here, in Switzerland, where the people 
didn't have any wars for 80 years,

Everything what he and the others have 
been through, there, in Nazi Germany.

Now, here, in Switzerland, it all seemed
just like an improbable and horrible nightmare.
Blumen Strasse - Flower Street

- Otto asked me to let you know, that 
yesterday he was awaiting your phone call.
- Please come inside.
And Pleyshner did come inside the apartment.

He didn't have a right to do that
because he didn’t get the correct answer.

The right answer should have been: "It’s strange. 
I was at home all day. He dialed a wrong number".

This was already Pleyshner’s 
second big mistake today.

How is "HE", our special main 
spy resident doing there?
Here it is. It’s for you.
All the information is in there.

Please feel yourself at home. 
I will be right back.

The intoxicating air of freedom played 
with professor Plyeshner a bad joke.

The secret apartment of a Russian spy 
was discovered by German Gestapo agents,
and here they awaited guests.

First of them was professor Pleyshner 
with a spy message from Shtirlitz.
This must be urgently delivered to our embassy.

Make sure there is a surveillance 
to watch after this funny character.

I'll try to keep him for a while and 
find out more information from him.

He is clearly an amateur. He's been used. 
I'll try to make him talk some information.

- How's the boss doing? Is he in good health? 
- Everything is in order.

- Would you like some coffee? 
- Yes, with pleasure. Thank you.

- How's your hotel? Is it a good one? 
- Yes, it is quite good.

- Do you have a reliable cover? 
- Well, my hotel room is on the second floor.

In Germany there is no such coffee. 
Those bastards sell pure garbage.
And here one can buy true Brazilian coffee.

I haven't had such coffee for ten years. 
I've forgotten a taste of good coffee.

Greeks showed me how to wash down 
strong coffee with ice cold water.
I never had coffee with cold water.

It's amusing. The contrast of temperatures and 
the taste creates a special sensation.
It is very interesting.

- And what did he request you to tell me in words? 
- What do you mean?

What did the spy boss order you to 
tell me in words personally?

Nothing. Only that single ampule 
with a secret spy message in it.
That is strange.

I thought that he’ll let me know, 
through you, when to expect him here.
No, he didn't tell me anything about that.

- You must be hungry. 
- No, I had a good breakfast.

- What about money? Do you have enough? 
- Enough for now.

If you would require more money, 
you would come to me for it.

- By the way, did you check for the "tail"? 
- A tail?

- What does that mean? A surveillance? 
- Yes.

- You know, I just didn't pay any attention. 
- That is very unwise.

That is very unwise. He, the main spy, 
perhaps did not instruct about this?

You know, after many years living there and 
especially after the concentration death camp,

for the first time I felt 
myself a free man again

and I just became intoxicated with this freedom. 
Thank you for reminding me about that.
You should never forget about that.
The local police here are very sly and sneaky.

- Do you have anything else for me? 
- Who me? I have nothing else.
Now, give me your passport.

He said that I should keep my
passport with me at all times.

- Did he tell you that from now on you 
are under my total command?  - No.

Actually you couldn't know that, because it was 
an order in the spy message you delivered to me.
We will think about how to use you here.
What are your plans for now?

I will return to the hotel and 
will sleep a whole day through.

- And what about your work here? 
- Firstly I want to have a long sleep.

I hope to have a sleep for an entire day 
and only then to undertake my work again.
I left all my manuscripts in Berlin.
But I do remember all my works almost by heart.

You will come a day after tomorrow 
to pick up your passport.

We ourselves will find a way to 
register you at the Swedish consulate.

To say more precisely, we will 
try doing that.
Those dirty swines, Swedes, behave sickeningly.
Who?
The Swedes.

They see Nazi Gestapo agents in anyone 
who ever passed through Germany.

It's not important to them, what kind of German 
are you, a patriot, who fights against Hitler,

or bloodhound from the Gestapo. 
Therefore it is necessary to be careful.

He didn't tell me that I must 
be registered at the consulate.

It all was in the encoded spy message
that you just brought to me.

- Would you like more coffee? 
- No, thank you.

Did you already informed "him" 
about your successful arrival?
Or do you want me do that?

I think that you would better 
do that through your channels.
But you from your side also inform him.

I wanted to, but I couldn't find 
the needed post stamp,
which I must stick on to the postcard.

A day after tomorrow I'll get that post 
stamp for you, even if it's not for sale.

- What must be on that stamp? 
- Climbing on Mont Blanc, dark blue color.

- Do you have the postcard with you? 
- No, it is in the hotel.
This is too bad.

You should not leave anything in the hotel. 
You are a foreigner,

so you could be watched after. 
You must be extra careful!

But it is just a usual postcard. 
I bought ten of them in Berlin.
And the message I memorized.

So from my side I don't 
think I did anything wrong.
Caution and caution again.

- The calmness here is only apparent. 
- I know. He warned me about that.

- Tell me the name of your hotel. 
- Boarding house "Virginia".

It has an English name. 
Is it an American Hotel?
I don't know. Why?

Foreigners like Hotel Virginia.
Especially Americans. They love it.

If you ever see me, do not say "Hi" to me. 
Remember - we are unfamiliar to each other.
Sure. Of course.

If anything extraordinary would happen 
to you or in any emergency

you will call this telephone 388-16-16. 
Try to memorize it.
388-16-16. I memorized it.

All right then. I'll see you after 
tomorrow here same time again.

-Would you like to purchase anything? 
-No, I simply enjoy watching the birds.
The most interesting birds are inside my store.

Everyone puts on the windows 
display the best things for sale,

and I feel they are not just items for sale. 
They are live. They are birds.

Sometimes even writers come here 
to listen to my singing birds.

One of them once said: "before I'd descend 
into the hell of a new book,

"I, like Orpheus, must listen to the most 
beautiful music. The music of singing birds.

otherwise I will not be able to sing my song 
to the world, to attract my Eurydice to me".
I want to thank you for everything.

- What do you thank me for? 
- I am just grateful to you for everything.

You're welcome. Come back again. 
All the best to you.

Shellenberg told me that Shtirlitz is away 
for a while doing a special secret task.

You must start working harder with the 
Russian radio operator while he's away.

Rolf will work out the contrast 
of methods of interrogation.

After an evil interrogator prisoners extra 
kin and open to a nice interrogator.

We'll try a nice one, then an evil one, then 
a nice one again. Shtirlitz is a nice one.

Yes, I am speaking to you. 
I want to hear the details of the operation.

Muller decided not to mention to 
Kaltenbruner that the fingerprints found

on the telephone in the special 
governmental-phone room

and the ones found on the suitcase of the 
Russian radio operator, were totally identical.

He also decided not to tell to 
Kaltenbrunner right now that

he secretly was collecting fingerprints 
of all the colleagues and officers.

He will loose temper and have 
his hysterics again"- thought Muller.

And he will blame him, Muller, for any failure, 
that missed an enemy in his own house.

Mueller was pleased, that about the conversation 
between Mr. Bormann and some officer of RSHA

was known to Himmler, but was 
not known to Kaltenbrunner at all.

Such political fork created a possibility 
to maneuver between the two forces.
Continue your secret operation.

Do you want me to control Shtirlitz's work 
with that Russian radio operator woman?
Why would you need to control his work?

He is sufficiently experiment and a clever 
person in the questions of spy radio tasks.

Will Rolf have his independent role in the 
work with the Russian female radio-pianist?
No, let Rolf work directly with Shtirlitz.
They are after the same goal, aren't they?

And the methods of achieving 
the goal can be different.

- Do we have new transmissions from the Russians? 
- No, nothing so far.

- Any successes from our encryption cracker? 
- They are working hard, but nothing yet.
It is a very strong cipher encryption.

Interrogate the Russian radio-pianist harder. 
I don't believe she doesn't know the code.
Shtirlitz works with her using his method.

While Shtirlitz is away, 
let Rolf interrogate her harder.
Don't turn on the light.
End of part 7.
